page.title: 17Angling.
page.content:
The{River Swale},below{Richmond Falls through{Easby}to the{Caravan Park}on the{Brompton-on-Swale}road, is where the anglers go coarse fishing.This river is controlled by the{Richmond {Angling Society}.The coarse fishes are Brown Trout,Grayling,Chub,Barbel and some pike.These fish are mostly caught with maggots or worms but Grayling and chubb can be caught with artificial flies.The stretch of river alongside the caravan site,and the lakes opposite, are controlled by the{D'arcy {Hildyard Angling Society}.In the lakes are Brown Trout, and Rainbow Trout can be caught by artificial flies or worms in low water during the flood.
(A.Partridge,G.Fenton)
